result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian C. Demeuse was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brian C. Demeuse is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brian C. Demeuse was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Alcohol / drug;  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.    Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. ** Pay fine of $300.00  and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
** Pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).  Obey all rules in WalWorth Co 07-CF-446.

Court reporter transcript invoice for 2/18/15 sentencing paid by county $36.00.

For Ct 2 only - Dismissed
For Ct 3 only - Dismissed and read in.

Defendant Brian C. Demeuse appeared with Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Jason Robert Zapf appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: ITC is: 2 years and six months, forthwith
ES  is: 2 years
TLS is: 4 years and six months
171 days sentence credit given. Sentence to run concurrent to Walworth County 07CF446. Conditions of extended supervision given. $300 fine plus court costs ordered. No restitution requested.  Defendant is eligible for the CIP and SAP programs.  Federal firearms warning and voter ineligibility status given to the defendant.  Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.  Appeal rights given.
Conditions of extended supervision imposed by the Judge

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  11:23am-  Victim rights compliance.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant admits to prior convictions.  Defendant entered a plea of no contest to count 1; found guilty by the court.  On the motion of the State, count 2 is dismissed & count 3 is dismissed & read-in.  Presentence Investigation ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Watson is requesting 11/25/2014 Final pre-trial be rescheduled - DE has a sentencing after revocation hearing in Walworth Co on 12/11/2014.  Final pre-trial is rescheduled to 1/7/2015 at 9:30am.  Parties notified via email.
